Pathway.Name: Cohesin complex - Cornelia de Lange syndrome
Pathway.Comment: Cohesin complex workings during mitotic and meiotic cell cycles.

DataNode.Comment: Phosphorylation of REC8 makes it more susceptible to separase cleavage
Phosphorylation of REC8 makes it more susceptible to separase cleavage

Interaction.Comment: This reaction is assumed by similarity to mitosis. Proper reference confimring this process in meiosis is required.
This reaction is assumed by similarity to mitosis. Proper reference confimring this process in meiosis is required.

Label.TextLabel: WAPL binding to PDS5 activates removal of cohesin

Label.Comment: NIPBL/MAU2(SCC4) form a complex and facilitate cohesin loading and unloading.
S phase: Sister chromatid cohesion is established mediated by sororin and ESCO1/ESCO2.
G2 phase: PDS5 maintains cohesion throughout G2 phase.
Start of the removal of the cohesin in prophase from chromome arms and is regulated by PLK1, Aurora B kinase, condensin 1, and WAPL.

During mataphase to anaphase transition, separase inhibitor securin is degraded by APC, which activates separase, which in turn cleaves centromeric cohesin and residual cohesin on chromosomes arms. This establishes sister chromatid separation.
